content.question:
Julio sells computers at an electronics store. Let the random variable <math alttext="uppercase C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of computers that Julio sells in one week. The following table shows the probability distribution of <math alttext="uppercase C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="lowercase c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></math>
0
1
2
3
4
5
6

<math alttext="the probability of, uppercase C equals lowercase c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
0.04
0.08
0.16
0.21
0.30
0.18
0.03

Julio earns $800 per week, with a commission of $200 per computer sold. What is the expected value of Julioâ€™s earnings for one week?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
